name: First Hawaiian, Inc.
description: First Hawaiian, Inc. is a leading financial services company headquartered in Honolulu, Hawaii. Founded in 1858, it is the oldest and largest bank in Hawaii. The company operates through its principal subsidiary, First Hawaiian Bank, which provides a comprehensive range of banking services including personal banking, business banking, investment services, and wealth management. With a strong commitment to community involvement and customer service, First Hawaiian Bank serves individuals, families, and businesses across the Hawaiian Islands, Guam, and other Pacific Islands. The bank has built a reputation for its reliable and personalized financial services, leveraging technology to enhance customer experience while maintaining a focus on traditional banking values. First Hawaiian, Inc. is publicly traded on the NASDAQ under the ticker symbol FHB and continues to expand its presence in the region, aiming to be the bank of choice for its customers. The company’s mission is to deliver exceptional financial solutions tailored to meet the unique needs of the diverse communities it serves.

seo.meta_title: First Hawaiian, Inc. | Banking and Financial Services
seo.meta_description: Discover First Hawaiian, Inc., the oldest and largest bank in Hawaii, providing a full range of personal, business, and investment services tailored to the unique needs of the communities it serves.

faq.answer: First Hawaiian Bank offers personal banking, business banking, and investment services.

faq.question: Where is First Hawaiian, Inc. headquartered?
faq.answer: First Hawaiian, Inc. is headquartered in Honolulu, Hawaii, USA.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of First Hawaiian, Inc.?
faq.answer: Bob Harrison is the CEO of First Hawaiian, Inc.

faq.question: When was First Hawaiian Bank founded?
faq.answer: First Hawaiian Bank was founded in 1858.
